All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
BattleCommandLine
Command line interface for choosing battles, running battles, and making player moves.
BattleScreen
Battle screen where player fights chosen opponent.
DebuffMonster
A special type of Monster, with a second attack which applies a debuff to the enemies damage.
DebuffMonsterTest
 
FlyingMonster
A special type of Monster, with a fly move, that allows them to not take damage in the next turn.
FlyingMonsterTest
 
GameEnvironment
The GameEnvironment contains everything else in the game and keeps track of game status, specifically it contains the Player entity, Shop entity, the battles the player can participate in and the number of days, current day and difficulty.
GameEnvironmentTest
 
GameOverCommandLine
The end of the command line program.
GameOverScreen
Game over screen shows player score, days passed, and options to restart or end game.
Generation
Handles random generation of Monsters, Players, and Items, given the day and difficulty (1-3).
GenerationTest
 
InventoryCommandLine
The command line interface for displaying the inventory, and choosing and using an item from it.
IO
A input output class simple functionality for the input and ouput required for the command line program through static methods.
Item
A single Item class, which contains the behviour for heal items, damage buff items, and full revives.
ItemBuilder
A class which constructs each type of item, taking in a price and if applicable a size.
ItemBuilder.ItemSize
An enum for the size of the item, either SMALL, MEDIUM, or LARGE.
ItemBuilderTest
 
ItemScreen
Item screen shows players inventory and team that allows items to be used out of battle.
ItemTest
 
Main
The main loop of the game, where the days are run.
MainScreen
The main screen of game, shows name, gold, current day of game.
Monster
Monster is the base class for any monster types, it is responsible for the monsters current status, including health, damage, level, xp, whether the monster is fainted or awake, and temporary status effects.
MonsterTest
 
Player
The Player entity is used both for the player as well as enemy teams you fight against.
PlayerTest
 
PoisonMonster
A special type of Monster with a poison attack.
PoisonMonsterTest
 
Purchaseable
The purchaseable interface shared by Monster and Item.
RiskyMonster
A special type of Monster, with a second attack which instant kills either the enemy or itself randomly.
RiskyMonsterTest
 
ScreenManager
Contains all methods that manages screen transitions, and is entry point for the GUI application.
SetupScreen
Initial screen to setup the game, ask player to enter name, choose starting monster, set number of days for the game and the difficulty.
Shop
The Shop conatins some stock, that is refreshed each day, and a variable tracking the total gold spent by the player.
ShopCommandLine
Command line interface for the shop, allowing the player to view and buy stock, and sell their own items and monsters.
ShopScreen
Shop screen allows player to buy and sell items/monsters.
ShopTest
 
Start
The entry point for the command line application, it sets up the game environment and passes off the running of the game to Main.
TeamCommandLine
Command line interface to display the Player's team, reorder the team, and rename individual monsters.
TeamScreen
Screen that shows all monsters in the team and allows player to rename monster.
TeamSizeLimit
A command line interface for checking the size of the player's team and promting them to remove a monster if the team is to large, this should be utilized whenever a monster is added to the team in the command line program.
